Implementations

1. Masked Loss

We define fixed width windows around a set of base alignments and provide a reference implementation of the banded loss in which we mask the state scores within windows and pass these to the original CTC loss computation:

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

window_start_positions[source]

window_start_positions(base_alignments, input_lengths, width, num_states)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

loss_masked[source]

loss_masked(logits, targets, input_lengths, target_lengths, base_alignments, width)

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sample_inputs = logits, targets, input_lengths, target_lengths = ctc.generate_sample_inputs(450, 500, 64, 20, 120, 150)
base_alignments = ctc.viterbi_alignments(*sample_inputs).argmax(2)
width = 64
loss_masked(*sample_inputs, base_alignments, width).item()

7.753539562225342
{% endraw %}

The masked loss is our ground-truth reference implementation for the banded losses below. In most practical situations the summation will be highly peaked around a single alignment so that the masked loss agrees to high accuracy with the result of the standard (full summation) loss. However for random inputs this is not always the case meaning that losses and gradients can differ significantly from the full summation even for relatively wide windows. For this reason a masked ground-truth reference is indispensible for identifying numerical errors in banded implementations.

{% raw %} 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
fwds, bwds = compare_fwd_bwd(partial(loss_masked, base_alignments=base_alignments, width=width), ctc.loss_cupy, *sample_inputs)
plt.scatter(bwds[0].flatten(), bwds[1].flatten(), alpha=0.05, s=0.05)
plt.xlabel('masked loss (width={!s})'.format(width)); plt.ylabel('full loss'); plt.title('gradients');

3. Cupy

{% raw %} 
%%writefile cuda/ctc_banded.cu
__device__ __forceinline__ FLOAT max3(FLOAT a, FLOAT a1, FLOAT a2) {
    FLOAT maxa = a > a1 ? a : a1; 
    return maxa > a2 ? maxa : a2;
}

__device__ __forceinline__ FLOAT logsumexp3(FLOAT a, FLOAT a1, FLOAT a2) {
    FLOAT maxa = max3(a, a1, a2); 
    return maxa + log(exp(a-maxa) + exp(a1-maxa) + exp(a2-maxa));
}

__device__ __forceinline__ FLOAT sum3(FLOAT a, FLOAT a1, FLOAT a2) {return a + a1 + a2;}
__device__ __forceinline__ FLOAT add(FLOAT a, FLOAT b) {return a + b;}
__device__ __forceinline__ FLOAT mul(FLOAT a, FLOAT b) {return a * b;}

extern "C" __global__ void fwd_bwd_banded(
    FLOAT* __restrict__ alpha_T, 
    FLOAT* __restrict__ alpha, FLOAT* __restrict__ beta,  
    const FLOAT* __restrict__ scores,  const bool* __restrict__ repeat_mask, 
    const long* __restrict__ lengths, const long* __restrict__ window_starts,
    int N, int L, int W
) {
    int bx = blockIdx.x, tx = threadIdx.x;
    if (tx >= W) return;
    extern __shared__ FLOAT smem[];
    int T = (int) lengths[bx];
    if (blockIdx.y == 0) {
        int prev = window_starts[bx];
        FLOAT a, a1, a2;
        a = alpha[bx * W + tx];
        for (int t = 0; t < T; t++) {
            int pos = (int) window_starts[(t + 1) * N + bx];
            int ix = tx + pos - prev;
            FLOAT *buf = smem + (t % 2) * blockDim.x;
            buf[tx] = a; __syncthreads();
            a = (ix < W) ? buf[ix] : ZERO;
            a1 = ((ix > 0) && (ix - 1 < W)) ? buf[ix - 1] : ZERO;
            a2 = ((ix > 1) && (!repeat_mask[bx * L + pos + tx])) ? buf[ix - 2] : ZERO; 
            a = MUL(scores[(t * N + bx) * W + tx], SUM(a, a1, a2));
            alpha[((t + 1) * N + bx) * W + tx] = a;
            prev = pos;
        }
        alpha_T[bx * W + tx] = a;
    }
    else {
        int prev = (int) window_starts[T * N + bx];
        FLOAT b, b1, b2;
        b = beta[(T * N + bx) * W + tx];
        for (int t = T; t > 0; t--) {
            int pos = (int) window_starts[(t - 1) * N + bx];
            int ix = tx + pos - prev;
            FLOAT *buf = smem + (t % 2) * blockDim.x;
            buf[tx] = MUL(b, scores[(((t - 1) * N + bx) * W) + tx]);
            __syncthreads();
            b = (ix >= 0) ? buf[ix] : ZERO;
            b1 = ((ix + 1 >= 0) && (ix + 1 < W)) ? buf[ix + 1] : ZERO;
            b2 = ((ix + 2 < W) && (!repeat_mask[bx * L + pos + tx + 2])) ? buf[ix + 2] : ZERO;
            b = beta[((t - 1) * N + bx) * W + tx] = SUM(b, b1, b2);
            prev = pos;
        }
    }
  }

Overwriting cuda/ctc_banded.cu

Banded Viterbi alignments

{% raw %} 
alignments = {
    'soft':    to_np(soft_alignments(logits, targets, input_lengths, target_lengths, base_alignments, width=64)),
    'viterbi': to_np(viterbi_alignments(logits, targets, input_lengths, target_lengths, base_alignments, width=64))
}

fig, axs = plt.subplots(2, 1, figsize=(12, 4))
for (k, alignment), ax in zip(alignments.items(), axs):
    ax.imshow(alignment[:, 0].T)
    ax.set_title(k)
